message.content:
cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the problem of computing the Fourier transform of high-dimensional vectors distributedly over a cluster of machines, which involves distributed computing, coding theory, and signal processing. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also leverages concepts from coding theory to deal with straggler effects, which suggests the possibility of cs.IT (Information Theory) as another likely category. The paper proposes a computation strategy that achieves the optimal recovery threshold, which involves optimization and algorithm design, indicating the possibility of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as another likely category. The paper also maps the reconstruction process to MDS decoding, which involves systems and control theory, suggesting the possibility of cs.SY (Systems and Control) as another likely category. Finally, the paper extends the proposed method to computing general n-dimensional Fourier transforms, which involves numerical analysis and scientific computing, indicating the possibility of cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) as another likely category.
